dict.string: osascript -e "tell application \"Alfred 3\" to search \"prepare to turn…\""

shotsFile="/tmp/turnandshoot" rm "${shotsFile}"
randomNum="$(grep -m1 -ao '[3-6]' /dev/urandom | head -1)" sleep ${randomNum}
touch "${shotsFile}"
cat << EOF <?xml version='1.0'?><items> <item uuid='Shoot' valid='no'> <title>Shoot!</title> <icon>iconAlt.png</icon> </item> </items> EOF

shotsFile="/tmp/turnandshoot" [[ -f "${shotsFile}" ]] && missed="no" || missed="yes"
echo "<?xml version='1.0'?><items>" echo "<item uuid='Shot' valid='yes'>" if [[ "${missed}" == "yes" ]]; then echo "<title>Player 1 missed…</title>" echo "<subtitle>Player 2 wins</subtitle>" else echo "<title>Player 1 hits!</title>" echo "<subtitle>Player 1 wins</subtitle>" fi echo "<icon>icon.png</icon>" echo "</item>" echo "</items>"

shotsFile="/tmp/turnandshoot" [[ -f "${shotsFile}" ]] && missed="no" || missed="yes"
echo "<?xml version='1.0'?><items>" echo "<item uuid='Shot' valid='yes'>" if [[ "${missed}" == "yes" ]]; then echo "<title>Player 2 missed…</title>" echo "<subtitle>Player 1 wins</subtitle>" else echo "<title>Player 2 hits!</title>" echo "<subtitle>Player 2 wins</subtitle>" fi echo "<icon>icon.png</icon>" echo "</item>" echo "</items>"

Following the footsteps of [PingPong](https://github.com/vitorgalvao/alfred-workflows/tree/master/PingPong), here’s now a two-player game for Alfred.
TurnShoot is a game where you try to react faster than your opponent. By default player 1 uses `q` and player 2 uses `p`, due to the position of both keys in a typical QWERTY keyboard. If you’d like to change these, see the bottom two nodes of the workflow and change the last letter of the `Keyword` input.
